technology: There were no technical difficulties during the conversation.
cur_neg_affect: The participant did not express any negative affect about the pandemic/masks/vaccine/boosters in the present.
past_neg_affect: The participant mentioned missing out on some senior year experiences, indicating a mild negative affect related to the past.
communal_orientation: The participant engaged in the conversation, shared their experiences, and responded to the conversation partner's questions, but didn't go above and beyond to build a strong connection.
engagement: The participant was generally engaged in the conversation, sharing their experiences and responding to questions, but not overly enthusiastic or proactive in driving the conversation.
defensiveness: The participant did not display any defensiveness in justifying their beliefs or perspective.

questions.transcript: So how is the exact transition for you?
What's your experience regarding the vaccination? And did you end up taking it?
What is going through in your mind that that point of time?

If they announced one more year, you're already took 4 or 4 of them, but if they announced, one more is going to be then, or if they may, they make it a flu shot which we which are supposed to take every year, what's your place it's going to be then?

similarity_statements.transcript: Yeah, so I, also had the same confusion.

vaccine_importance: The participant did not explicitly state their belief on the importance of vaccines at the end of the conversation.
booster_importance: The participant did not explicitly state their belief on the importance of boosters at the end of the conversation.
cognitive_complexity: The participant showed some consideration of different aspects of the pandemic and vaccines, but didn't delve deeply into complex analysis or nuanced perspectives.
general_notes: The participant seemed relatively nonchalant about the pandemic and vaccines, taking a fairly passive approach to the situation.
